intro: Iris barnumiae var. zenobiae, commonly known as the Zenobia iris, is a striking ornamental plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It features tall, slender stems that bear showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive white or pale pink center. The plant has narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are typically evergreen, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical significance lies in its unique coloration and adaptability to high-altitude environments.
